enum.name: MAV_CMD
enum.description: Commands to be executed by the MAV. They can be executed on user request, or as part of a mission script. If the action is used in a mission, the parameter mapping to the waypoint/mission message is as follows: Param 1, Param 2, Param 3, Param 4, X: Param 5, Y:Param 6, Z:Param 7. This command list is similar what ARINC 424 is for commercial aircraft: A data format how to interpret waypoint/mission data. NaN and INT32_MAX may be used in float/integer params (respectively) to indicate optional/default values (e.g. to use the component's current yaw or latitude rather than a specific value). See https://mavlink.io/en/guide/xml_schema.html#MAV_CMD for information about the structure of the MAV_CMD entries

entry.name: MAV_CMD_GO_THROUGH_PORTAL
entry.description: Go through a portal. In an indoor exploration context, a portal represents an structural identifiable entry or pass point to start, stop or continue an exploration. COMMAND_INT should be used so to set the MAV_FRAME and consequently, frame and coordinates of the portal position (MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL means global coordinates are being used, while MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED means local NED coordinates are being used).
entry.param: ID of the portal. If the ID is unknown or not deterministic, set it to UINT32_MAX and use params 5, 6 and 7 to define the local or global position of the portal.
X or Latitude (WGS84) coordinate of the portal position. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown (or if using param 1 to set the portal).
Y or Longitude (WGS84) coordinate of the portal position. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown (or if using param 1 to set the portal).
Z or Altitude (MSL) coordinate of the portal position. NaN when unknown or when using param 1 to set the portal.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_INGRESS_PORTAL
entry.description: Sets a specific portal to be an entry portal. Defines also the approach vector for a vehicle to approach and go through the portal. COMMAND_INT should be used so to set the MAV_FRAME and consequently, frame and coordinates of the approach vector (MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL means global coordinates are being used, while MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED means local NED coordinates are being used).
entry.param: ID of the portal to be set as an ingress point.

param.label: Approach vector initial point X or Latitude

entry.param: X (mE4) or Latitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the initial point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector initial point Y or Longitude

entry.param: Y (mE4) or Longitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the initial point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector initial point Z or Altitude (MSL)

entry.param: Z or Altitude (MSL) coordinate of the initial point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector final point X or Latitude

entry.param: X (mE4) or Latitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the final point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector final point Y or Longitude

entry.param: Y (mE4) or Longitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the final point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector final point Z or Altitude (MSL)

entry.param: Z or Altitude (MSL) coordinate of the final point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN if unknown.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_EGRESS_PORTAL
entry.description: Sets a specific portal to be an entry portal. Defines also the approach vector for a vehicle to approach and go through the portal. COMMAND_INT should be used so to set the MAV_FRAME and consequently, frame and coordinates of the approach vector (MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL means global coordinates are being used, while MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED means local NED coordinates are being used).
entry.param: ID of the portal to be set as an egress point.

param.label: Approach vector initial point X or Latitude

entry.param: X (mE4) or Latitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the initial point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector initial point Y or Longitude

entry.param: Y (mE4) or Longitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the initial point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector initial point Z or Altitude (MSL)

entry.param: Z or Altitude (MSL) coordinate of the initial point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector final point X or Latitude

entry.param: X (mE4) or Latitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the final point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector final point Y or Longitude

entry.param: Y (mE4) or Longitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the final point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.

param.label: Approach vector final point Z or Altitude (MSL)

entry.param: Z or Altitude (MSL) coordinate of the final point of the approach vector to the portal. NaN if unknown.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_EXPLORATION
entry.description: Start or continue the exploration task. If starting a new exploration, but requiring to get through a portal first, params 4 or 5 to 7 should be set and different from the specified ignore values. Continuing an exploration can be done without necessarily setting the ingress portal, unless the exploration requires the definition of more than the initial ingress portal. If the passed exploration ID does not exist or is not listed as a valid exploration ID in the vehicle autonomy engine, then this command should be rejected. COMMAND_INT should be used so to set the MAV_FRAME and consequently, frame and coordinates of the portal position (MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL means global coordinates are being used, while MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED means local NED coordinates are being used).
entry.param: Sets the ID of the exploration task to start. If the ID already exists, it resumes that (queued/listed) exploration task. Set to UINT8_MAX if one wants to resume the last exploration task.
Time limit to execute the exploration. Reaching this time triggers the behavior defined in param 4. Set to 0 when there is no time limit.
The behavior after stopping the exploration task. 0: Hold, 1: Land, 2: Return to position.

ID of the ingress portal. If the ID is unknown, not deterministic, or when already in the area to explore after going through a portal, set it to UINT32_MAX and use params 5, 6 and 7 to define the local or global position of the portal. Note that an egress portal is not defined by this command but can be consequently set either by the vehicle autonomy engine or by an operator/external controller using MAV_CMD_SET_EGRESS_PORTAL.
X (mE4) or Latitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the portal position. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown (or if using param 4 to set the portal).
Y (mE4) or Longitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the portal position. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown (or if using param 1 to set the portal).
Z or Altitude (MSL) coordinate of the portal position. NaN when unknown or when using param 4 to set the portal ID.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_STOP_EXPLORATION
entry.description: Stop an exploration task. The behavior after stopping is defined by a parameter Return to position should take the vehicle to the defined exit portal first, and then to the return post-exploration point (accessible through EXPLORATION_RETURN_POSITION). If the passed exploration ID does not exist or is not listed as a valid exploration ID in the vehicle autonomy engine, then this command should be rejected.
entry.param: Sets the ID of the (current or queued) exploration task to stop. Set to UINT32_MAX if one wants to stop the current exploration task.
The behavior after stopping the exploration task. 0: Hold, 1: Land, 2: Return to position.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_EXPLORATION_RETURN_POS
entry.description: Sets the return position after stopping or finishing an exploration task. Used when the vehicle autonomy engine does not set this position or to overwrite it. COMMAND_INT should be used so to set the MAV_FRAME and consequently, frame and coordinates of the position (MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL means global coordinates are being used, while MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED means local NED coordinates are being used).
entry.param: Yaw or heading of the return position. NaN if unknown.
X (mE4) or Latitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the return position. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.
Y (mE4) or Longitude (degE7) (WGS84) coordinate of the return position. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.
Z or Altitude (MSL) coordinate of the return position. NaN or INT32_MAX if unknown.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_EXPLORATION_RETURN
entry.description: Return to a system-defined position after exploration.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_EXPLORATION_BOUNDARIES
entry.description: Set exploration task world boundaries. When starting a new behavior, either the system has default boundaries or it iss boundless. This message will be accepted when the task ID already exists, or otherwise should fail. In order to set the exploration task world boundaries, p1 and p2 identify the vertices of a rectangle, which define a 2D localization of the exploration area, while p3, matching the same coordinates of p1, provides the height limitation of the 3D volume to explore. In short, the coordinates are x1, y1, x2, y2, z and the height of the cuboid / 3D volume, where the point coordinates can be represented by p1(x1, y1, z+h), p2(x2, y2, z+h) and p3(x1, y1, z). COMMAND_INT should be used so to set the MAV_FRAME and consequently,frame and coordinates of the boundaries cuboid (MAV_FRAME_GLOBAL means global coordinates are being used, while MAV_FRAME_LOCAL_NED means local NED coordinates are being used).
entry.param: ID of the exploration task to set these boundaries to. Set to UINT8_MAX if not applicable or/and to set these boundaries to the current running or active exploration task.

Exploration 3D space boundaries cuboid height. The Z local coordinate or altitude (MSL) of point 1 and 2 are computed by the sum of this height with the local Z or altitude (MSL) of point 3, i.e Z1 = Z2 = Z3 + cuboid height. NaN if not applicable.

param.label: Approach vector initial point Y or Longitude

entry.param: Local X (mE4) or Latitude (degE7) (WGS84) of point 1 of the exploration 3D space boundaries cuboid. NaN or INT32_MAX if not applicable.

param.label: Approach vector initial point Z or Altitude (MSL)

entry.param: Local Y (mE4) or Longitude (degE7) (WGS84) of point 1 of the exploration 3D space boundaries cuboid. NaN or INT32_MAX if not applicable.

param.label: Approach vector final point X or Latitude

entry.param: Local X (mE4) or Latitude (degE7) (WGS84) of point 2 of the exploration 3D space boundaries cuboid. NaN or INT32_MAX if not applicable.

param.label: Approach vector final point Y or Longitude

entry.param: Local Y (mE4) or Longitude (degE7) (WGS84) of point 2 of the exploration 3D space boundaries cuboid. NaN or INT32_MAX if not applicable.

param.label: Approach vector final point Z or Altitude (MSL)

entry.param: Local Z or Altitude (MSL) point 3 of the exploration 3D space boundaries cuboid. This also represents the height of the bottom plane of the cuboid. NaN if not applicable.

entry.name: MAV_CMD_SET_POI_FOCUS
entry.description: Sets a POI at the current focus point of the camera frame. This assumes that the camera system has the ability to geo-locate the current focus point.
entry.param: Operation mode. 0 = set POI at current location; 1 = set POI at current location and track it.

param.label: X Position in the camera frame

entry.param: Position given by the number of pixels in X direction of the camera frame. Origin on the bottom left corner of the camera frame.

param.label: Y Position in the camera frame

entry.param: Position given by the number of pixels in Y direction of the camera frame. Origin on the bottom left corner of the camera frame.

enum.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION
enum.description: Point-of-Interest classification. Used on the the POI_REPORT 'classification' field. Provides default classes (0 to 2147483647).

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_RESIDENTIAL_BUILDING
entry.description: Residential building. Eg. house, cottage, housebarn, tonwhouse, retirement home.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_COMERCIAL_RETAIL_BUILDING
entry.description: Comercial retail building. Eg. shopping center, retail outlet.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_COMERCIAL_HOTEL_BUILDING
entry.description: Comercial hotel building. Eg. hotel, motel, resort.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_COMERCIAL_SPECIAL_PURPOSE_BUILDING
entry.description: Comercial special purpose building. Eg. theater, cinema, self-storage, marina.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_INDUSTRIAL_FLEX_SPACE_BUILDING
entry.description: Industrial flex space building. Eg. data center, showroom, laboratory.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_AGRICULTURAL_BUILDING
entry.description: Agricultural building. Eg. barn, greenhouse, silo, stable, windmill, chickenhouse.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_INFRASTRUCTURE_BUILDING
entry.description: Infrastructure building. Eg. dam, power plant, waste transfer cetner, composting facility.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_INSTITUTIONAL_MEDICAL_BUILDING
entry.description: Institutional medical building. Eg. hospital, nursing home.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_INSTITUTIONAL_EDUCATIONAL_BUILDING
entry.description: Institutional educational building. Eg. college, school, orphanage.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_INSTITUTIONAL_CIVIC_BUILDING
entry.description: Institutional civic building. Eg. library, museum, community hall.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_INSTITUTIONAL_RELIGIOUS_BUILDING
entry.description: Institutional religious building. Eg. church, monastery, synagogue.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_INSTITUTIONAL_GOVERNMENT_BUILDING
entry.description: Institutional government building. Eg. embassy, police station, fire station, city hall, post office.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_INSTITUTIONAL_MILITARY_BUILDING
entry.description: Institutional military building. Eg. barracks, arsenal, bunker, citadel.

entry.name: POI_CLASSIFICATION_INSTITUTIONAL_TRANSPORTATION_BUILDING
entry.description: Institutional transportation building. Eg. airport, bus station, lighthouse, ferry terminal.

enum.name: MAV_EXPLORATION_STATUS_FLAGS
enum.description: Exploration status flags, sent as part of the EXPLORATION_STATUS message.

entry.name: MAV_EXPLORATION_STATUS_FLAGS_TASK_START_INHIBITED
entry.description: Exploration task start is inhibited, caused by a fault or unmet condition.

entry.name: MAV_EXPLORATION_STATUS_FLAGS_TASK_OUT_OF_BOUNDS
entry.description: Vehicle detected to be out of defined exploration boundaries of the exploration task.

entry.name: MAV_EXPLORATION_STATUS_FLAGS_VIO_FAULT
entry.description: Exploration task fault caused by a VIO problem.

entry.name: MAV_EXPLORATION_STATUS_FLAGS_NAVIGATION_FAULT
entry.description: Exploration task fault caused by a navigation problem.

message.name: POI_REPORT
message.description: Reports information for a detected Point-of-Interest (POI). This can be either set by an operator (through MAV_CMD_SET_POI_FOCUS) or through onboard software or external processes. The receiving system should track the POI being reported based on its UID + time of detection + time of update. Detection time happens once for the same UID, while time of update changes when a specific metadata of that POI gets changed (e.g. position). The time of update should be changed on the sending system, based on the determined data in regards to that specific POI. So, POIs that are received again should be updated if the time of update has changed. Note: The sending system should repeat the current POIs at a fixed default rate of at 2Hz to keep the protocol stateless. The fixed rate though can be set by the receiver using MAV_CMD_SET_MESSAGE_INTERVAL, which is advised for POIs that are not static or for which the state updates are high - decision on the rates of some specific POIs is at the implementers consideration.
message.field: Unique ID for a given POI. Updates to a POIs information should use the same uid. 0 means unknown.
Timestamp (time since system boot).
Timestamp (time since UNIX epoch) of the POI detection, in UTC. 0 for unknown.
Timestamp (time since UNIX epoch) of the last POI update, in UTC. 0 for unknown.
Generic confidence level. Can be used for an implementation specific confidence level. 0..100, UINT8_MAX when unknown.
Confidence level of the POI detection. 0..100, UINT8_MAX when unknown.
Confidence level of the POI classification. 0..100, UINT8_MAX when unknown.
Confidence level of the POI localization. 0..100, UINT8_MAX when unknown.
Time to live: If this time has elapsed since last update, the POI should be deleted on the receiver side. A value of 0 should indicate no timeout.
Bitmask for POI status. Bit 1: POI is in focus on camera, Bit 8: POI has been cleared and should be deleted.
Latitude (WGS84) of the POI. If unknown: INT32_MAX (both Lat/Lon).
Longitude (WGS84) of the POI. If unknown: INT32_MAX (both Lat/Lon).
Altitude of the POI with respect to the MSL. Positive for up. NaN if unknown.
Altitude of the POI with respect to the EGM96 ellipsoid. Positive for up. NaN if unknown.
Altitude of the POI with respect to the ground level. Positive for up. NaN if unknown.

Classification of the POI. Can either used the POI_CLASSIFICATION enumeration (0x0 - 0x7FFFFFFF reserved), or use the reserved range for implementation specific classifications (0x80000000 - UINT32_MAX).
X position of the POI in the local NED frame. The local frame might either be the vehicle navigation frame or a common reference frame to multiple systems. NAN if unknown.
Y position of the POI in the local NED frame. The local frame might either be the vehicle navigation frame or a common reference frame to multiple systems. NAN if unknown.
Z position of the POI in the local NED frame. The local frame might either be the vehicle navigation frame or a common reference frame to multiple systems. NAN if unknown.
Orientation quaternion (w, x, y, z order) of the POI in the NED frame. Zero-rotation is 1, 0, 0, 0. Unknown is NAN, NAN, NAN, NAN.
Distance from the aircraft sensor/camera focal point to the POI. NAN if unknown.
North velocity of the POI. NAN if unknown.
East velocity of the POI. NAN if unknown.
Down velocity of the POI. NAN if unknown.
Heading of the POI in the NED frame. NAN if unknown.
Height of the POI shape. When the geometry is a circle, sphere or cylinder, represents the radius. NAN if unknown.
Width of the POI shape. NAN if unknown.
Depth of the POI shape. NAN if unknown.
POI geometry type.

Recommended vector start point, in the NED frame, for vehicle approach to the POI. This can either be determined by the end system where the POI was detected or by a system forwarding the information to another vehicle. Unknown is NaN, NaN, NaN.

Recommended vector end point, in the NED frame, for vehicle approach to the POI. This can either be determined by the end system where the POI was detected or by a system forwarding the information to another vehicle. Unknown is NaN, NaN, NaN.

Recommended NED velocity for vehicle approach to the POI. This can either be determined by the end system where the POI was detected ir by a system forwarding the information to another vehicle. Unknown is NaN, NaN, NaN.
Name of the POI, if the system provides one. NULL terminated string.

APP-6(D) standard symbol 30-digit Symbol Identification Code (SIDC) that provides the necessary information to display a tactical symbol. The SIDC is formed with eleven elements which are presented in two sets of ten digits and an additional set of ten digits composed of three elements, which are optional. Any unspecified element should be set to '0'. The way these codes are built can be checked on the Annex A to the APP-6 - NATO Joint Military Symbology, version D. NULL terminated string.

message.name: EXPLORATION_STATUS
message.description: Provides status over an exploration task. The message should, by default, be streamed at 1Hz.
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.
Remaining time for the vehicle to execute the exploration task, after which another predefined behavior is triggered. UINT64_MAX when unknown or not applicable.
ID of the exploration task. 255 if not applicable or unknown.
Progress measurement of the exploration task. Specific meaning may vary by implementation, but in general, increasing values mean more has been explored. UINT16_MAX when unknown or not applicable.

Measurement of the known size of the exploration task. Specific meaning may vary, but when progress == denominator, this should imply that exploration is complete. This value may increase as more need to explore is discovered, or may be fixed (100 recommended) if the end state is known (e.g., exploration in a known mapped environment). 0 when no meaningful size can be communicated.
Bitmap of the exploration task status flags.

In an indoor exploration task, it indicates the floor/level of the structure that is currently being explored. The level where the vehicle started the exploration is considered the level 0. INT8_MAX when unknown, not capable to provide or not applicable.

message.name: EXPLORATION_INFO
message.description: Provides configuration information about an exploration task. The message can be requested using the MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE command, where param 3 should be used to set which exploration task to get. To determine all coordinates of the cuboid, consider: p1_x equals p3_x, p1_y equals p3_y, p1_z equals p2_z, p1_lat equals p3_lat, p1_lon equals p3_lon and p1_alt equals p2_alt.
message.field: ID of the exploration task. 255 to get the information of the current running exploration task.
Time limit to execute the exploration. Reaching this time triggers the behavior defined in the behaviour_after_stopping field. Set to 0 when the exploration time is not limited.
The behavior after stopping the exploration task. 0: Hold, 1: Land, 2: Return (to exploration return position).
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 1 Latitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX if unknown. p1_lat == p3_lat.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 1 Longitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX if unknown. p1_lat == p3_lat.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 1 Altitude (MSL). NaN if unknown. p1_alt == p2_alt.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 1 local NED X coordinate. NaN if unknown. p1_x == p3_x.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 1 local NED Y coordinate. NaN if unknown. p1_y == p3_y.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 1 local NED Z coordinate. NaN if unknown. p1_z == p2_z.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 2 Latitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX if unknown.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 2 Longitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX if unknown.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 2 local NED X coordinate. NaN if unknown.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 2 local NED Y coordinate. NaN if unknown.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 3 Altitude (MSL). NaN if unknown.
Exploration cuboid boundaries point 3 local NED Z coordinate. NaN if unknown.

Currently defined ingress portal ID. This portal ID can either be set by the system autonomy engine or by an offboard controller or operator using MAV_CMD_SET_INGRESS_PORTAL. When unknown, not applicable or not deterministic, set to UINT32_MAX.
Currently defined ingress portal Latitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX if unknown, not applicable or when ingress_portal_id is set and different from UINT32_MAX.
Currently defined ingress portal Longitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX if unknown, not applicable or when ingress_portal_id is set and different from UINT32_MAX.
Currently defined ingress portal Altitude (MSL). NaN if unknown, not applicable or when ingress_portal_id is set and different from UINT32_MAX.

Currently defined egress portal ID. This portal ID can either be set by the system autonomy engine or by an offboard controller or operator using MAV_CMD_SET_EGRESS_PORTAL. When unknown, not applicable or not deterministic, set to UINT32_MAX.
Currently defined egress portal Latitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX if unknown, not applicable or when egress_portal_id is set and different from UINT32_MAX.
Currently defined egress portal Longitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX if unknown, not applicable or when egress_portal_id is set and different from UINT32_MAX.
Currently defined egress portal Altitude (MSL). NaN if unknown, not applicable or when egress_portal_id is set and different from UINT32_MAX.

message.name: EXPLORATION_RETURN_POSITION
message.description: Provides the return-from-exploration position when an exploration is completed (e.g. volume set by the exploration boundaries does not have new open areas for the vehicle to explore) or canceled (e.g. the operator stops the exploration task and requests the vehicle to leave the defined exploration area). Can either be set by the vehicle's onboard autonomy engine or set by the user MAV_CMD_SET_EXPLORATION_RETURN_POS. A MAV_CMD_NAV_EXPLORATION_RETURN can be used to send the vehicle to the position defined by this message. This message can be requested by sending the MAV_CMD_REQUEST_MESSAGE command.
message.field: Timestamp (UNIX Epoch time or time since system boot). The receiving end can infer timestamp format (since 1.1.1970 or since system boot) by checking for the magnitude of the number.
Latitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX when unknown.
Longitude (WGS84). INT32_MAX when unknown.
Altitude (MSL). Positive for up. Note that virtually all GPS modules provide both WGS84 and MSL. INT32_MAX when unknown.
Altitude above ground. INT32_MAX when unknown.
Altitude relative to WGS84 geoid. INT32_MAX when unknown.
Local X position of this position in the local coordinate NED frame. NaN when unknown.
Local Y position of this position in the local coordinate NED frame. NaN when unknown.
Local Z position of this position in the local coordinate NED frame. NaN when unknown.
World to surface heading transformation of the return-from-exploration position. Used to indicate the heading with respect to the ground. NaN when unknown.
